728516f-a.text:
Bay Street, west side, between Broad Street and Vanderbilt Ave., showing the United States Marine Hospital. This is the of the buildings which now constitute the hospital. It appear
maps of 1874.
About 1905.
By Eugene G. Putnam.
From Staten Island Museum Collection.
Through P. L. Sperr.
728516f-a.folder: Bay Street & Broad Street, Staten Island, NY

728620f-a.text:
23 to 35 Broad Street, north side, between Bay and Wright Streets. The view is westward from the head of Brownell Street.
February 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
728620f-a.folder: Broad Street & Bay Street, Staten Island, NY

728517f-b.text:
Bay Street, west side, between Broad Stroet and Vanderbilt Avenue, showing the United States Marine Hospital, seen across the tracks of the Staten Island Railroad from the Upper New York Bay shore. The new
hospital units were erected in 1934.
Views 1, 2: July 22, 1935
View 3: May 25, 1935
P. L. Sperr
728517f-b.folder: Bay Street & Broad Street, Staten Island, NY
